channel.title: Posts on elmcgu
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on elmcgu

item.title: TryHackMe CTF - Pickle Rick
item.description: Pickle Rick CTF In the following post I go through how I solved the Pickle Rick CTF on TryHackMe which can be found here - https://tryhackme.com/r/room/picklerick Recon After launching the CTF machine, I grabbed the IP address and used the tool ffuf to try and uncover all the files on the server. The -c argument colorises the output, -w to specify the wordlist i want to use to enumerate and -u for the target followed by FUZZ keyword.

item.title: Juice Shop Challenge Guide - Injection
item.description: Juice Shop Injection Vulnerabilities This article goes through all the injection challenges on OWASP Juice Shop. You can find all the challenges here: https://pwning.owasp-juice.shop/companion-guide/latest/part2/injection.html Login Admin Log in with the administrator’s user account. To begin, I tested for sql injection by submitting ' as the email address on the log-in form and an unexpected object response was triggerred, suggesting the login form is vulnerable to sql injection. This also resulted in a challenge being solved as shown below.

item.title: Juice Shop Challenge Guide - Score-board
item.description: Find the Hidden Score-Board I opened the developer tools in my browser. I investigated the body of the html but couldn’t find anything so I searched for “/score” in main.js and found the link I input the route to the browser and was re-directed to the score-board page. That solved the challenge and now the score-board is accessible from side-nav.

item.title: Pentesting VPC - Host private vulnerable machines in the cloud for free and access from anywhere
item.description: Setting-up OWASP Juice Shop on AWS with Private VPN Access Background/Overview Preparing for a Capture The Flag (CTF) competition led me to discover OWASP’s Juice Shop during our developer club meeting. Juice Shop, a vulnerable web app, offers free usage, enriching educational experience and craic. I’ve been running it on a separate machine on my local network since my initial introduction but this isn’t much good if I have a time to practice when I’m out and about.
